Playground.WelcomeText:
Please, select your playground to configure your own network or choose built-in example to explore step by step how neural networks operate.
Use the hints by hovering the question mark button to understand how to configure your network.

Please note, this interactive playground is just for learning purposes.

Dataset.Title: Training Phase
Dataset.Information: Maximum sample limit is {{SAMPLE_LIMIT}}. Data should be scaled to values between [{{SAMPLE_MINVALUE}}-{{SAMPLE_MAXVALUE}}]

NetworkConfig.AddHiddenLayer: Use this button to add a new hidden layer to the list below for further configuration. In sum you can add maximum of {{MAX_NUM_LAYERS}} layers. That is the upper limit in this application.
NetworkConfig.WeightDistribution: Select the random initialization of the neural network weight. The values will take random values between -0.5 and 0.5.
NetworkConfig.Layer: Move the slider to set the number of neurons in the layer. Also, select the activation function which layer neurons should use for their output calculation.
NetworkConfig.InputLayer: The only exception is the input layer, where by default the activation function is the identity function and this can't be changed.

DatasetConfig.AddSamplesButton: Use this button to add samples individually.
DatasetConfig.ClearSamplesButton: Use this button to delete all samples.
DatasetConfig.FromFileButton: Use this button to upload samples. Pay attention, that the the file should contain a comma separated inputs and outputs per row for single sample. The number of columns must correspond to the number of inputs and outputs toghether. For example, if we have 4 inputs and 2 ouputs, then the first 4 values will be treated as input and the last 2 as outputs. Also, the data should be scaled to values between [{{SAMPLE_MINVALUE}}-{{SAMPLE_MAXVALUE}}], otherwise it will be skipped.
